cat.lump.aq.textextraction.wikipedia.categories

Class DomainVocabulary

  • java.lang.Object
    • cat.lump.aq.textextraction.wikipedia.categories.DomainVocabulary
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class DomainVocabulary
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

    A DomainVocabulary instance is used to store a set of terms with its frequency. It means, each entry contains the number of times that has been added to the dictionary (its frequency).

    It is able to insert terms from a text as well as a collection of strings. Before adding new terms they are preprocessed as follows:

    1. Case folding the input.
    2. Remove stop words.
    3. Remove diacritics.
    4. Apply a stemming process.
    5. Filter only alphabetic tokens with a size greater than or equal to a given value (By default, characters).
    After this preprocess, the unknown terms are added to the dictionary with a frequency of 1, but the previously contained are modified by incrementing its frequency by 1. The preprocess behavior can be easily changed extending this class and redefining the preprocess(String) function.

    It also provides functions to get its content in other ways. On the one hand, it is able to save them in a file (binary or textual) with the serialize(File) and toFile(File) functions respectively. On the other hand, it can be transformed into a list of TermFrequencyTuple using the toList() function.

    Author:
    cmops
    See Also:
    TermFrequencyTuple, Serialized Form

      • getFrequency

        public int getFrequency(java.lang.String term)
        Gives the frequency of the given term.
        Parameters:
        term - The term to check its frequency.
        Returns:
        The absolute frequency of the term. If the term is not contained in the vocabulary, it returns 0.

      • getTop

        public DomainVocabulary getTop(float percentage)
        Extracts the most frequent terms of the vocabulary.
        Parameters:
        percentage - The percentage which defines the top to extract. The percentage is given by a value between 0 and 1.
        Returns:
        A new DomainVocabulary instance which contains the extracted terms.

      • getTop

        public DomainVocabulary getTop(int qtt)
        Extract the qtt most frequent terms of the vocabulary.
        Parameters:
        qtt - Number of terms to extract
        Returns:
        A new DomainVocabulary instance which contains the extracted terms.

      • toList

        public java.util.List<TermFrequencyTuple> toList()
        Exports the vocabulary as a list of tuples which contains the term and its frequency. This list has not any order.
        Returns:
        A list of tuples with the contents of the vocabulary.
        See Also:
        TermFrequencyTuple

      • toFile

        public void toFile(java.io.File output)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Exports the vocabulary to a textual file. This file is composed by N lines where each one contains one vocabulary entry. The DomainVocabulary instances saves in this way can be loaded using the insertFromFile(File) function. Each line has the following format: "term\tfrequency".
        Parameters:
        output - Path to the output file. If it doesn't exists, it will be created. If it already exists, it will be overwritten.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • serialize

        public void serialize(java.io.File output)
        Saves the vocabulary in a binary file. The DomainVocabulary instances saves in this way can be loaded using the loadfromFile(File) function.
        Parameters:
        output - Path to the output file. If it doesn't exists, it will be created. If it already exists, it will be overwritten.

      • loadfromFile

        public static DomainVocabulary loadfromFile(java.io.File input)
        Creates a DomainVocabulary instance by reading a binary file which contains a domain vocabulary.
        Parameters:
        input - Path to the binary file which contains a domain vocabulary.
        Returns:
        A DomainVocabulary instance which is equal to the one stored in the input file.

      • insertFromFile

        public void insertFromFile(java.io.File input)
        Inserts the terms stored in the given file into the domain vocabulary. The unkown terms of the file are added to the current vocabulary and the previously added terms are modified incrementing its frequency by the frequency stored in the file.
        Parameters:
        input - Path to the readable file which contains a set of terms stored with the format used by the toFile(File) function.

      • preprocess

        protected java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> preprocess(java.lang.String text)
        Preprocess a text to extract its terms as defined in TermExtractor.getTerms();
        Parameters:
        text - The text to preprocess.
        Returns:
        The collection of tokens accepted from the given text.

      • setMinimumSize

        public void setMinimumSize(int size)
        Changes the minimum size of the tokens to be accepted as terms of the vocabulary.
        Parameters:
        size - The new size.

      • setTerms

        public void setTerms(java.util.Collection<TermFrequencyTuple> terms)
        Sets a collection of tuples formed by a term and its frequency as vocabulary. This call implies the purging of the current vocabulry.
        Parameters:
        terms - The new terms of the vocabulary.

      • getLanguage

        public java.util.Locale getLanguage()
        Returns:
        The locale that defines the language used by this vocabulary.

      • getMinimumSize

        public int getMinimumSize()
        Returns:
        The minimum size of the terms after preprocess them to be accepted as new term.

      • getTerms

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getTerms()
        Returns:
        The terms and its frequency. Each key of the map is a term of the vocabulary and the value related to the key is the frequency of that term.
